headline: Stocks to Watch Recap: Hershey, Oracle, New York Times
summary: ↗️Hershey (HSY): Shares in the chocolate maker rose 4.3% after Goldman Sachs upgraded its recommendation on the shares to buy from sell. ↘️ Hims & Hers (HIMS): Shares of the telehealth platform dropped 5.

headline: Klarna post-IPO rating, Ralph Lauren outlook, Hershey upgrade
summary: Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma joins Market Domination with Josh Lipton to take a look at some of Tuesday's trading session's trending tickers and stories: Wall Street initiating coverage of Klarna (KLAR), Ralph Lauren's (RL) weak growth outlook, and Goldman Sachs analysts upgrading the Hershey Company (HSY). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Hershey (HSY) Stock Is Up, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of chocolate company Hershey (NYSE:HSY) jumped 3.9% in the afternoon session after Goldman Sachs issued a rare double upgrade on the stock, moving its rating from 'Sell' to 'Buy' and significantly raising its price target.

headline: Wall Street Turns Bullish on Hershey. Why the Stock Is in a Sweet Spot.
summary: Hershey recently raised prices across its confection portfolio, and consumers didn’t balk as much as expected.

headline: Apple, Warner Bros–Discovery, Hershey: Top analyst calls
summary: Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Allie Canal outlines major calls Wall Street analysts have made recently: TD Cowen downgrading Warner Bros Discovery (WBD), Goldman Sachs upgrading Hershey (HSY) and raising its price target for the stock, and Bernstein calling Apple (AAPL) a "winner" and a top play as the firm initiates coverage on multiple IT hardware names. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Hershey’s pricing power to ease high cocoa cost, says Goldman Sachs
summary: Investing.com -- Goldman Sachs upgraded Hershey Co to Buy from Sell, saying the chocolate maker’s recent market share gains and stronger pricing backdrop should help offset pressure from high cocoa costs and tariffs.
